page.title: 07EVENTS 2 P WAKLEY
page.content: Church Festivals are attended by most villagers: Easter, Harvest festival and Christmas. There is a Harvest Supper after Evensong in the Village Hall, after which some form of entertainment is provided; this year it was community singing. Other concerts given by choirs or hand-bell ringers are given in the Church once or twice a year. At Christmas the Sunday School puts on a Nativity Play in the Hall and, with "grown-ups", goes Carol Singing around the Village and to the old people at Gittisham Hill House. Every year during the summer holiday the Sunday School organises an outing or treat. This year three events took place: a nature trail at Catshayes farm, a treasure hunt at Combe House Hotel and a Barbeque followed by a rounders match at the playing field.
